forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 61. West southwest wind 5 to 8 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Sunny then Slight Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers after 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 68 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
Under the soft blanket of an evening in Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a gentle chill with the temperature settling near 61. The clouds hang serenely overhead, a canvas of muted gray against the fading light, while a mild west-southwest breeze whispers through the streets. As night deepens, the fog may waver in and out, a signature of the Bay that offers both mystery and comfort—a reminder of the maritime embrace this city knows so well.

As Monday unfolds, one might anticipate the sun peeking through wisps of cloud, introducing a slight chance of rain later in the afternoon. Expect a high reaching around 70 before a subtle descent to a cooler embrace as the day winds down. The winds, stronger at times, will stir the leaves, coaxing the vibrant energy of the city into life. For those stepping out, a light jacket or sweater will serve well against the fickle chill, perfect for enjoying a stroll along the waterfront or a quiet moment in one of the city’s many parks. It’s a day that invites you to meander through the local cafés, perhaps indulging in a warm cup of coffee while watching the world drift by, draped in the unique charm of San Francisco’s ever-shifting skies.
